title: One Last Cruise: A Collection of Short Stories
description: One Last CruiseLuke McEwen's debut collection of short stories reveals the passion, humour and anxiety in everyday life: - A married couple in their eighties take a risk, determined to live their lives the way they’ve always done. - Brighton hosts a modern take on the Greek myth of Medusa, revealing the consequences of living with injustice. - A university student displays her natural gift as a listener, an essential skill to achieving her ambition as a counsellor. - A small token of little monetary value takes on great symbolic importance when a daughter loses her mother. - A middle aged business man tries to repair his marriage with the same techniques he uses in the boardroom. “Heart-warming contemporary fiction with a quirky flavour. A great variety of interesting stories with some funny twists.”“The writing is both beautiful and witty. I highly recommend this collection of stories for anyone who wants to be swept away by a great story teller.”“The author truly understands his protagonists, and has a perfect grasp on human relationships and the essential ingredients needed for survival.”
author: Luke McEwen
